channel.title: Findings on Virginia Tech
channel.description: Recent content in Findings on Virginia Tech

item.title: Findings 1
Findings 2
item.description: /* this chunnk of code centers all of the headings */ h1, h2, h3 { text-align: center; } Modeling Census Tract Level Evictions : Richmond: Visualizing An Index Of Eviction Intensity The Eviction Intensity Index we created from our regression model was used to rank all census tracts in U.S. cities that are comparable in size to Richmond in the United States. The wordcloud below visualizes the frequency that census tracts with the words “Richmond City” show up in a list of the top 320 most eviction intense tracts in the US.

item.title: Findings 3
item.description: /* this chunnk of code centers all of the headings */ h1, h2, h3 { text-align: center; } Modeling Census Tract Level Evictions: Visualization of socio-demographic variables and eviction rates in Richmond 2013-2018 To provide further guidance for policymakers interested in understanding evictions in Richmond, we provide a dashboard that can be used to visualize the socio-demographic variables that our statistical model identified as being associated with eviction rates.

item.title: Conclusion
item.description: /* this chunnk of code centers all of the headings */ h1, h2, h3 { text-align: center; } We determined that state level landlord and tenant friendly policies are significantly associated with tract level eviction rates. These finding suggested that state level policy levers such as: Laws that protected class exemptions in housing-related transactions, Laws that protect tenants from retaliation by landlords Laws that reduce the number of exemptions landlords have from state landlord-tenant law can affect evictions rates.

item.title: References

Eviction Lab National Database: Version 1.0. Princeton: Princeton University, 2018, www.evictionlab.org. Washington, Lark. “Rehouse Richmond: Plan to Address the Eviction Crisis.” (2020). Desmond, Matthew. 2012 “Eviction and the reproduction of urban poverty.
